verses.verse: Ἔπειτα <WG1899> Epeita vvv διὰ <WG1223> dia later ( The Council at Jerusalem) δεκατεσσάρων <WG1180> dekatessarōn Fourteen ἐτῶν <WG2094> etōn years πάλιν <WG3825> palin again ἀνέβην <WG305> anebēn I went up εἰς <WG1519> eis to Ἱεροσόλυμα <WG2414> Hierosolyma Jerusalem , μετὰ <WG3326> meta accompanied by Βαρνάβα <WG921> Barnaba Barnabas . συμπαραλαβὼν <WG4838> symparalabōn I took καὶ <WG2532> kai also . Τίτον <WG5103> Titon Titus along

ἀνέβην <WG305> anebēn I went δὲ <WG1161> de - κατὰ <WG2596> kata in response to ἀποκάλυψιν <WG602> apokalypsin a revelation καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀνεθέμην <WG394> anethemēn set before αὐτοῖς <WG846> autois them τὸ <WG3588> to the εὐαγγέλιον <WG2098> euangelion gospel ὃ <WG3739> ho that κηρύσσω <WG2784> kēryssō I preach ἐν <WG1722> en among τοῖς <WG3588> tois the ἔθνεσιν <WG1484> ethnesin Gentiles . κατ’ <WG2596> kat’ vvv ἰδίαν <WG2398> idian [I spoke] privately δὲ <WG1161> de But τοῖς <WG3588> tois to those δοκοῦσιν <WG1380> dokousin recognized as leaders , μή <WG3361> mē vvv πως <WG4459> pōs [for fear that] εἰς <WG1519> eis in κενὸν <WG2756> kenon vain . τρέχω <WG5143> trechō I was running ἢ <WG2228> ē or ἔδραμον <WG5143> edramon had already run

ἀλλ’ <WG235> all’ Yet οὐδὲ <WG3761> oude not even Τίτος <WG5103> Titos Titus , ὁ <WG3588> ho who [was] σὺν <WG4862> syn with ἐμοί <WG1473> emoi me , Ἕλλην <WG1672> Hellēn a Greek . ὤν <WG1510> ōn [even though] he was ἠναγκάσθη <WG315> ēnankasthē was compelled περιτμηθῆναι <WG4059> peritmēthēnai to be circumcised ,

διὰ <WG1223> dia because δὲ <WG1161> de [This issue arose] τοὺς <WG3588> tous [some] παρεισάκτους <WG3920> pareisaktous under false pretenses ψευδαδέλφους <WG5569> pseudadelphous false brothers οἵτινες <WG3748> hoitines - παρεισῆλθον <WG3922> pareisēlthon had come in κατασκοπῆσαι <WG2684> kataskopēsai to spy on τὴν <WG3588> tēn - ἐλευθερίαν <WG1657> eleutherian freedom ἡμῶν <WG1473> hēmōn our ἣν <WG3739> hēn - ἔχομεν <WG2192> echomen - ἐν <WG1722> en in Χριστῷ <WG5547> Christō Christ Ἰησοῦ <WG2424> Iēsou Jesus , ἵνα <WG2443> hina in order ἡμᾶς <WG1473> hēmas us . καταδουλώσουσιν <WG2615> katadoulōsousin to enslave

οἷς <WG3739> hois to [them] οὐδὲ <WG3761> oude vvv πρὸς <WG4314> pros for ὥραν <WG5610> hōran a moment , εἴξαμεν <WG1502> eixamen We did not give in τῇ <WG3588> tē . . . ὑποταγῇ <WG5292> hypotagē . . . ἵνα <WG2443> hina so that ἡ <WG3588> hē the ἀλήθεια <WG225> alētheia truth τοῦ <WG3588> tou of the εὐαγγελίου <WG2098> euangeliou gospel διαμείνῃ <WG1265> diameinē would remain πρὸς <WG4314> pros with ὑμᾶς <WG4771> hymas you .

Ἀπὸ <WG575> Apo as for δὲ <WG1161> de But τῶν <WG3588> tōn the δοκούντων <WG1380> dokountōn highly esteemed εἶναί <WG1510> einai . . . τι <WG5100> ti . . . — ὁποῖοί <WG3697> hopoioi whatever ποτε <WG4218> pote . . . ἦσαν <WG1510> ēsan they were οὐδέν <WG3762> ouden vvv μοι <WG1473> moi to me ; διαφέρει <WG1308> diapherei makes no difference πρόσωπον <WG4383> prosōpon . . . ὁ <WG3588> ho . . . Θεὸς <WG2316> Theos God ἀνθρώπου <WG444> anthrōpou . . . — ( Literally God does not accept the face of man) οὐ <WG3756> ou vvv λαμβάνει <WG2983> lambanei does not show favoritism ἐμοὶ <WG1473> emoi to me . γὰρ <WG1063> gar - οἱ <WG3588> hoi those δοκοῦντες <WG1380> dokountes leaders οὐδὲν <WG3762> ouden nothing προσανέθεντο <WG4323> prosanethento added

ἀλλὰ <WG235> alla vvv τοὐναντίον <WG5121> tounantion On the contrary , ἰδόντες <WG3708> idontes they saw ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that πεπίστευμαι <WG4100> pepisteumai I had been entrusted [to preach] τὸ <WG3588> to the εὐαγγέλιον <WG2098> euangelion gospel τῆς <WG3588> tēs to the ἀκροβυστίας <WG203> akrobystias uncircumcised , καθὼς <WG2531> kathōs just as Πέτρος <WG4074> Petros Peter [ had been ] τῆς <WG3588> tēs to the περιτομῆς <WG4061> peritomēs circumcised .

ὁ <WG3588> ho the [One who] γὰρ <WG1063> gar For ἐνεργήσας <WG1754> energēsas was at work Πέτρῳ <WG4074> Petrō in Peter’s εἰς <WG1519> eis . . . ἀποστολὴν <WG651> apostolēn apostleship τῆς <WG3588> tēs to the περιτομῆς <WG4061> peritomēs circumcised ἐνήργησεν <WG1754> enērgēsen was also at work καὶ <WG2532> kai . . . ἐμοὶ <WG1473> emoi in my [apostleship] εἰς <WG1519> eis to τὰ <WG3588> ta the ἔθνη <WG1484> ethnē Gentiles .

καὶ <WG2532> kai And γνόντες <WG1097> gnontes recognizing τὴν <WG3588> tēn the χάριν <WG5485> charin grace τὴν <WG3588> tēn [that] δοθεῖσάν <WG1325> dotheisan had been given , μοι <WG1473> moi I Ἰάκωβος <WG2385> Iakōbos James καὶ <WG2532> kai - , Κηφᾶς <WG2786> Kēphas Cephas , ( That is, Peter; also in verses 11 and 14) καὶ <WG2532> kai and Ἰωάννης <WG2491> Iōannēs John — οἱ <WG3588> hoi those δοκοῦντες <WG1380> dokountes reputed στῦλοι <WG4769> styloi pillars — εἶναι <WG1510> einai to be δεξιὰς <WG1188> dexias [the] right hand ἔδωκαν <WG1325> edōkan gave ἐμοὶ <WG1473> emoi me καὶ <WG2532> kai and Βαρνάβα <WG921> Barnaba Barnabas κοινωνίας <WG2842> koinōnias of fellowship , ἵνα <WG2443> hina so that ἡμεῖς <WG1473> hēmeis we [ should go ] εἰς <WG1519> eis to τὰ <WG3588> ta the ἔθνη <WG1484> ethnē Gentiles , αὐτοὶ <WG846> autoi they δὲ <WG1161> de and εἰς <WG1519> eis to τὴν <WG3588> tēn the περιτομήν <WG4061> peritomēn circumcised .

μόνον <WG3440> monon [They] only [asked us] τῶν <WG3588> tōn the πτωχῶν <WG4434> ptōchōn poor , ἵνα <WG2443> hina to μνημονεύωμεν <WG3421> mnēmoneuōmen remember ὃ <WG3739> ho - καὶ <WG2532> kai - ἐσπούδασα <WG4704> espoudasa I was eager αὐτὸ <WG846> auto the very τοῦτο <WG3778> touto thing ποιῆσαι <WG4160> poiēsai to do .

( Paul Confronts Cephas) Ὅτε <WG3753> Hote When δὲ <WG1161> de however , ἦλθεν <WG2064> ēlthen came Κηφᾶς <WG2786> Kēphas Cephas εἰς <WG1519> eis to Ἀντιόχειαν <WG490> Antiocheian Antioch , κατὰ <WG2596> kata to πρόσωπον <WG4383> prosōpon face , αὐτῷ <WG846> autō his ἀντέστην <WG436> antestēn I opposed [him] ὅτι <WG3754> hoti because κατεγνωσμένος <WG2607> kategnōsmenos to be condemned . ἦν <WG1510> ēn he stood

πρὸ <WG4253> pro before τοῦ <WG3588> tou - γὰρ <WG1063> gar For ἐλθεῖν <WG2064> elthein came τινας <WG5100> tinas certain men ἀπὸ <WG575> apo from Ἰακώβου <WG2385> Iakōbou James , μετὰ <WG3326> meta with τῶν <WG3588> tōn the ἐθνῶν <WG1484> ethnōn Gentiles . συνήσθιεν <WG4906> synēsthien he used to eat ὅτε <WG3753> hote when δὲ <WG1161> de But ἦλθον <WG2064> ēlthon they arrived , ὑπέστελλεν <WG5288> hypestellen he began to draw back καὶ <WG2532> kai and ἀφώριζεν <WG873> aphōrizen separate ἑαυτόν <WG1438> heauton himself , φοβούμενος <WG5399> phoboumenos for fear of τοὺς <WG3588> tous those ἐκ <WG1537> ek in περιτομῆς <WG4061> peritomēs [the] circumcision [ group ] .

καὶ <WG2532> kai - συνυπεκρίθησαν <WG4942> synypekrithēsan joined him in his hypocrisy αὐτῷ <WG846> autō . . . , καὶ <WG2532> kai vvv οἱ <WG3588> hoi The λοιποὶ <WG3062> loipoi other Ἰουδαῖοι <WG2453> Ioudaioi Jews ὥστε <WG5620> hōste so that καὶ <WG2532> kai even Βαρνάβας <WG921> Barnabas Barnabas συναπήχθη <WG4879> synapēchthē was led astray . αὐτῶν <WG846> autōn their τῇ <WG3588> tē by ὑποκρίσει <WG5272> hypokrisei hypocrisy

Ἀλλ’ <WG235> All’ - ὅτε <WG3753> hote When εἶδον <WG3708> eidon I saw ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that οὐκ <WG3756> ouk vvv ὀρθοποδοῦσιν <WG3716> orthopodousin they were not walking in line πρὸς <WG4314> pros with τὴν <WG3588> tēn the ἀλήθειαν <WG225> alētheian truth τοῦ <WG3588> tou of the εὐαγγελίου <WG2098> euangeliou gospel , εἶπον <WG2036> eipon I said τῷ <WG3588> tō - Κηφᾷ <WG2786> Kēpha to Cephas ἔμπροσθεν <WG1715> emprosthen in front of πάντων <WG3956> pantōn [them] all , Εἰ <WG1487> Ei “ If σὺ <WG4771> sy you , Ἰουδαῖος <WG2453> Ioudaios a Jew , ὑπάρχων <WG5225> hyparchōn who are ἐθνικῶς <WG1483> ethnikōs like a Gentile καὶ <WG2532> kai and οὐκ <WG3756> ouk not Ἰουδαϊκῶς <WG2452> Ioudaikōs like a Jew , ζῇς <WG2198> zēs live πῶς <WG4459> pōs how τὰ <WG3588> ta the ἔθνη <WG1484> ethnē Gentiles ἀναγκάζεις <WG315> anankazeis can you compel ἰουδαΐζειν <WG2450> ioudaizein to live like Jews ? ” ( Some translators close this quotation after verse 16 or 21.)

Ἡμεῖς <WG1473> Hēmeis We [who are] φύσει <WG5449> physei by birth Ἰουδαῖοι <WG2453> Ioudaioi Jews καὶ <WG2532> kai and οὐκ <WG3756> ouk not ἐξ <WG1537> ex vvv ἐθνῶν <WG1484> ethnōn Gentile Ἁμαρτωλοί <WG268> Hamartōloi “ sinners ”

εἰδότες <WG1492> eidotes know δὲ <WG1161> de - ὅτι <WG3754> hoti that οὐ <WG3756> ou vvv δικαιοῦται <WG1344> dikaioutai is not justified ἄνθρωπος <WG444> anthrōpos a man ἐξ <WG1537> ex by ἔργων <WG2041> ergōn works νόμου <WG3551> nomou of [the] law , ἐὰν <WG1437> ean but μὴ <WG3361> mē . . . διὰ <WG1223> dia by πίστεως <WG4102> pisteōs faith Χριστοῦ <WG5547> Christou Christ . Ἰησοῦ <WG2424> Iēsou in Jesus καὶ <WG2532> kai So we, too ἡμεῖς <WG1473> hēmeis . . . , εἰς <WG1519> eis in Χριστὸν <WG5547> Christon Christ Ἰησοῦν <WG2424> Iēsoun Jesus , ἐπιστεύσαμεν <WG4100> episteusamen have believed ἵνα <WG2443> hina that δικαιωθῶμεν <WG1344> dikaiōthōmen we may be justified ἐκ <WG1537> ek by πίστεως <WG4102> pisteōs faith Χριστοῦ <WG5547> Christou in Christ καὶ <WG2532> kai and οὐκ <WG3756> ouk not ἐξ <WG1537> ex by ἔργων <WG2041> ergōn works νόμου <WG3551> nomou of the law , ὅτι <WG3754> hoti because ἐξ <WG1537> ex by ἔργων <WG2041> ergōn works νόμου <WG3551> nomou of the law οὐ <WG3756> ou no one δικαιωθήσεται <WG1344> dikaiōthēsetai will be justified . πᾶσα <WG3956> pasa . . . σάρξ <WG4561> sarx . . .

Εἰ <WG1487> Ei if , δὲ <WG1161> de But ζητοῦντες <WG2212> zētountes while we seek δικαιωθῆναι <WG1344> dikaiōthēnai to be justified ἐν <WG1722> en in Χριστῷ <WG5547> Christō Christ , εὑρέθημεν <WG2147> heurethēmen are found to be καὶ <WG2532> kai . . . αὐτοὶ <WG846> autoi we ourselves ἁμαρτωλοί <WG268> hamartōloi sinners , ἆρα <WG686> ara does that make Χριστὸς <WG5547> Christos Christ ἁμαρτίας <WG266> hamartias of sin ? διάκονος <WG1249> diakonos a minister μὴ <WG3361> mē vvv γένοιτο <WG1096> genoito Certainly not !

εἰ <WG1487> ei If γὰρ <WG1063> gar - ἃ <WG3739> ha - κατέλυσα <WG2647> katelysa I have already torn down , ταῦτα <WG3778> tauta what πάλιν <WG3825> palin . . . οἰκοδομῶ <WG3618> oikodomō I rebuild παραβάτην <WG3848> parabatēn [to be] a lawbreaker . ἐμαυτὸν <WG1683> emauton myself συνιστάνω <WG4921> synistanō I prove

ἐγὼ <WG1473> egō I γὰρ <WG1063> gar For διὰ <WG1223> dia through νόμου <WG3551> nomou [the] law νόμῳ <WG3551> nomō to [the] law ἀπέθανον <WG599> apethanon died ἵνα <WG2443> hina so that Θεῷ <WG2316> Theō to God . ζήσω <WG2198> zēsō I might live

Χριστῷ <WG5547> Christō Christ , συνεσταύρωμαι <WG4957> synestaurōmai I have been crucified with ζῶ <WG2198> zō live , δὲ <WG1161> de and οὐκέτι <WG3765> ouketi no longer ἐγώ <WG1473> egō I ζῇ <WG2198> zē lives δὲ <WG1161> de but ἐν <WG1722> en in ἐμοὶ <WG1473> emoi me . Χριστός <WG5547> Christos Christ ὃ <WG3739> ho The [life] δὲ <WG1161> de - νῦν <WG3568> nyn vvv ζῶ <WG2198> zō I live ἐν <WG1722> en in σαρκί <WG4561> sarki [the] body , ἐν <WG1722> en by πίστει <WG4102> pistei faith ζῶ <WG2198> zō I live τῇ <WG3588> tē - τοῦ <WG3588> tou in the Υἱοῦ <WG5207> Huiou Son τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou of God , τοῦ <WG3588> tou who ἀγαπήσαντός <WG25> agapēsantos loved με <WG1473> me me καὶ <WG2532> kai and παραδόντος <WG3860> paradontos gave Himself up ἑαυτὸν <WG1438> heauton . . . ὑπὲρ <WG5228> hyper for ἐμοῦ <WG1473> emou me .

Οὐκ <WG3756> Ouk vvv ἀθετῶ <WG114> athetō I do not set aside τὴν <WG3588> tēn the χάριν <WG5485> charin grace τοῦ <WG3588> tou - Θεοῦ <WG2316> Theou of God . εἰ <WG1487> ei if γὰρ <WG1063> gar For διὰ <WG1223> dia through νόμου <WG3551> nomou the law , δικαιοσύνη <WG1343> dikaiosynē righteousness [comes] ἄρα <WG686> ara - Χριστὸς <WG5547> Christos Christ δωρεὰν <WG1432> dōrean for nothing . ἀπέθανεν <WG599> apethanen died
